other_tests.findings: Subepidermal blister with sharp separation of the dermis, preservation of the papillae, and a sparse infiltrate around the vessels of the superficial plexus. Mild thickening of the papillary vessel walls was observed.
Nonspecific changes with mild infiltration of lymphocytes in Glisson’s capsule; iron deposits were recognized.
A total of 820 mL were removed over 5 weeks, leading to a decrease in serum iron and urinary uroporphyrin (UP) levels.
other_tests.changes_over_time: For 2 years, there was no recurrence of PCT.

other_tests.findings: Phlebotomy conducted for a total of 840 mL over 5 weeks; serum iron levels decreased to between 50 and 60 µg/dL, and patient was discharged in good condition.
A total of 2200 mL venesection was conducted, with highly elevated levels of urinary UP, and serum iron and ferritin noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The rate of decrease in serum iron and ferritin, and urinary UP was slower compared to previous phlebotomies.
